intro: Petrophile plumosa, commonly known as the silky rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its soft, silky foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or heathland environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are borne on slender stems and attract various pollinators. Petrophile plumosa is well adapted to drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
